budget-line.narrative: DGF II works around a sphere approach. Each sphere is defined as a 'domain of governance' covering a number of specific areas of intervention. The sphere approach will contribute to more complementary and less compartmentalised functioning of the programme. The responsibility of each sphere is to facilitate and manage the implementation of activities designed for the specific areas of intervention under each respective sphere. Sphere members manage the relationship between DGF and implementing partners, and provide advice and quality assurance regarding the implementation of the strategies, workplans and budgets in line with sphere strategic priorities. Collectively, the funds allocated to spheres makes up the programme costs.

The CCU is tasked with working with Sphere, Finance and CCU team efforts to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of partnership management procedures by overseeing monitoring and evaluation, documentation and communication of results, and partner learning and capacity development. The unit is comprised on 5 sections; Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E), Management Information Systems (MIS). Human Resources (HR), Comunication and Knowledge Management (CKM), Organisational Development (OD) and Gender and Youth (GY).

The Finance and Administration unit is responsibvle for the day to day financial and administrative management and internal control of the DGF. The unit reviews all contracts and financial reports and undertakes any other duties in connection with the programme including budgetting and grant reconcilliation.
